We were briefly putting JUnit test code into subpackages named 'test',
in the main source tree, at the same level as the code they tested.

However, Reddy had previously made a better suggestion: collect tests
in a parallel source directory, testsrc, with a package structure
mirroring the components tested. 

This not only avoids cluttering the main src tree, but also allows
the test classes easier access to tested components: 'imports' aren't
necessary and package protected access is available.

So please move existing tests, and place all future tests, under 
/testsrc rather than /src.

- Gordon
